result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin R Petroviak

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Kevin R Petroviak.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for further proceedings related to the Schiffer-Green Motion. Discussion placed on the record. State advised the Court, regarding medical release form. Court ordered case adjourned to allow time for the State to receive requested documents. Case remains calendared in Br 45.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Kevin R Petroviak.  Assistant District  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Parties proceed with Schiffer-Green Motion.  Arguments from State and Defense heard.  The Court ordered this matter adjourned for further proceedings related to the Schiffer-Green Motion.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Further proceedings scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court_1 - Petroviak, Kevin R.pdf, Filed.
MOTION FOR IN-CAMERA INSPECTION OF RECORD, received and filed.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting to file a Schiffer-Green motion.  The State does not object, The Defense has until 8/26 to file motion; the state has until 9/16 to respond/reply.  The Court will vacate the jury status hearing and the jury trial scheduled in Br 45.  Case remains calendared for motion hearing in Br 45.  The court did not hear the pro se bail motion.  mn  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defense Motion in Limine, Filed.
Defense Witness List, Filed.
Defense Jury Instructions, Filed.

Motion and Notice of Motion for Bail Reduction from Defendant ( Kevin Petroviak 8885 S 68 th St Franklinm Wi 53233)
Notice of Intent to use DNA Evidence at Trial
Statements of LW placed on the record. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court, defendant Kevin R Petroviak not in court, in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared on behalf of Alicia Kort for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by  08/05/2022. Case adjourned to Branch 34.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BAIL

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak, appear by video in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn, appear by video.  Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Village Of Hales Conners Dectective C. Heckman.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in court, in custody CJF via Zoom.  Jack Eichorst for Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin R Petroviak appeared by video means.  Tom Reed appears for OPD.  Based on statements, court appoints Attorney Lori Kuehn to represent defendant in this matter at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled for June 9, 8:30 am.  kmw

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Matter is adjourned to Br. 34 for a State V. Lee hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with MRW, Lauren W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $20,000.00.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No contact order monitoring only.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Kevin R Petroviak in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
